item.title: usefull resources
item.description: here are some usefull resources I rely on suckless.org cat-v landchad.net based.cooking eff fsf ~varsh you can use all of these by bookmarking them in your browser and donating to these services.

item.title: thoughts on modern medicine
item.description: HOMEOPATHY: turning water into money since 1810 –Dr Aust Tl;Dr Its not just black and white, good or bad. I have mixed feeling but i am optimistic about this. TOC The bad part The good part The bad part It not that medicine is evil, we all need them to live a healthy and less stressful life. Its the medicine companies or as every social media influencer puts it “BIG PHARMA” I hate.

item.title: neovim customization
item.description: Why use vim and neovim over other text editors and IDEs? For me, I’ve always loved minimalism and performance over ease of use and other flashy bloat no one really uses and cares about. This why I personally use Terminal-based text editors. Preferably VIM or Neovim. Tho I currently, am running Neovim, but both of them are basically the same. NeoVIM is a little bit more extensible than VIM and easy to manage imo.

Here I will be posting some of my recommendations for the books I read. Tho these may not be all computer or tech related but would probaly be a good read if you want to read something new. Also if you want to purchase these books please do so from the provided link as it is an affiliate like which would give me a small commision on your purchase.
